text: Greggs plc is a British bakery chain. It started in 1939 It specialises in savoury products such as bakes, sausage rolls, sandwiches and sweet items including doughnuts and vanilla slices. Its headquarters are in Newcastle upon Tyne, England. It is listed on the London Stock Exchange, and is a constituent of the FTSE 250 Index. Originally a high street chain, it has since entered the convenience and drive-thru markets. It expanded between 2022 and 2024, starting to sell vegan food. It opened 145 new sites in 2023 bringing the total number to 2,473. It also increased the size of its existing stores. ==Products== Products include sausage rolls, vegan sausage rolls, meat-free steak bakes, bacon rolls, croissants, pains au chocolat, sandwiches, and soups. ==Gallery== File:Greggs store front.jpg|Historic shop front, Greggs, Brecon (2005) File:11 Abbeygate Street, Bury St Edmunds, October 2022 02.jpg|Greggs in a Grade II* listed building on Abbeygate in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk File:Gregg's, 115 Albion Street, Leeds (14th November 2018).jpg|A Greggs branch in Leeds, West Yorkshire. File:Gregg's meat-free sausage roll (home-baked) 2021 05.jpg|The Greggs meat-free sausage roll (home-baked) ==References== Category:1939 establishments in Europe Category:1930s establishments in the United Kingdom Category:Food companies of the United Kingdom Category:Organisations based in Newcastle upon Tyne
title: Greggs
